comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! His class was by far one of the easiest classes I've ever taken in the Spanish department. He makes his class a fun environment to be in and is super patient with everyone. We did a lot of group work to practice our Spanish, had 3 oral exams and one group project. He provides the textbook online. Overall, one of the best!
He was very good at making class not feel incredibly long. There is a lot of group work. If you do the work, you will be fine. Not much to say, good or bad.
Easy going guy, very few grades available so do the work. He was so chill and everything was very easy to do as long as you paid attention and finished everything. Easy A for pegs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Jackson is by far one of the best professors I have had. Attendance is not mandatory, but sometimes he does in-person assignments that you would miss if you didn't come. He always answers emails in a timely fashion and answers any questions you have. He really cares about his students' success. I would definitely recommend him.

SUCH a good professor. The class is very laid back and he has structured it well. Hardly any homework except for working on the papers that you write in the course but they're not bad. He's super nice and flexible. I would recommend him 1000%.
Best Professor I had at KSU. Really cared about students and the course and is eager to help you learn and to teach. I wish I could take him again!

Best professor I've had! He grades very fairly and gives great feedback. Attendance wasn't "mandatory", but you're graded on participation at the end. I wish I could take him for every one of my Spanish classes.

Doctor Jackson is MAGICAL. He is extremely lenient on due dates, and excluding tests and quizzes he only grades on completion, not accuracy. Attendance is not mandatory but sometimes he has "pop" in class assignments, but if you miss any you can just do it on your own time. Class was SO much fun, but he does expect you to speak and participate.

Take him!!! He really cares about each student learning. He helps with any questions you might have. You don't need to be afraid to speak Spanish in his class, he will direct you in the right way. He does take points off your final grade if you miss too many classes so keep that in mind. He loves conversation and is a great professor! My fav

Professor Jackson explains tough grammar concepts in ways that make sense. He cares about his students and wants to help each one succeed. Class is interactive--expect to be called on to answer questions in Spanish. A good bet for anyone looking for Spanish credit, and easily one of my favorite professors so far at KSU.

I didn't get the best grade but that isn't due to him. He really worked with me during the summer semester to make sure I did what I could. He requires a lot of class participation and will call on you to answer stuff in Spanish, but he's a really cool professor if you give him a chance.
